events.name: Deep Tech Stories: Australia and Singapore
events.description: Please register here, https://www.sginnovate.com/events/deep-tech-stories-australia-and-singapore Deep Tech Stories: Australia and Singapore Presented by SGInnovate As emerging technologies like Artificial Intelligence and Virtual Reality make its impact at work and in our daily lives, we are told stories about companies in places such as Silicon Valley, China and the UK. What is happening in our Southeast Asian and Pacific region? How can our region innovate and compete with these other regions? Come and join a panel discussion with companies visiting from Australia as well as Singaporean companies who will share what they are working on in deep tech industries such as AI, VR, Cybersecurity, etc. as we discuss opportunities to collaborate between the two countries. Date: 25 June 2018Time: 5:30pm – 7:30pmVenue: BASH, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #03-01, Singapore 139955 Programme:5:30pm – 6:00pm: Registration6:00pm – 7:00pm: Deep Tech Stories from Australia and Singapore7:00pm – 7:30pm: Networking and End Speakers: Corey Manders, Founder, BetaSight TechnologiesJonathan Chang, CEO, SilverpondMurray James, Co-Founder and CEO, Snobal
events.location: BASH, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Level 3, Singapore

events.name: WINGS: ICO curation and valuation dApp & BridgeX Network: Bridging Crypto/Fiat
events.description: WINGS and BridgeX Network will be presenting. (1) WINGS - 7pm -7.45pm WINGS is an Ethereum based Dapp that lets people curate and value ICO projects, and assigns reviewers a "forecast rating" score based on their correctness forecasting ICO funding results the FR score is then used for weighed curation amongst reviewer accounts and to obtain more accurate valuation forecasts from the crowd. Dominik will cover the lessons learned from the WINGS alpha and beta regarding decentralized ICO deal curation, valuation forecasting and funding failures, success and future developments of the WINGS Dapp, what opportunities that presents for other Dapp developers and people involved in ICO financing. Please visit Wings.ai for more information. Speaker:Dominik is a co­founder of WINGS, a community of project backers which evaluates ICOs responsible for over $650M in funding, and Head of Communications at WINGS Stiftung. He was Head of Communications & BizDev at Mastercoin (now Omni) Foundation ­ the 1st project to perform an ICO. Advisor at AdEx, Flixxo, DomRaider, MedicalChain, Symbiosis and AnthemGold. Many years ago he is proud to have been distinguished with top Inside Technology Sales Award for the North America Sales unit at Oracle Corporation. He was also co­founder of State Software Inc. the company which discovered, coined and helped popularize the JSON standard. He holds a BA, Economics and Political Science (minor) from Middlebury College, and was a Industrial Management MSc candidate at the Blekinge Institute of Technology in Sweden. ---(2) BridgeX Network - 7.45pm - 8.30pm BridgeX Network is a decentralised financial ecosystem that bridges the worlds of cryptocurrency and fiat, revolutionising interoperability across spaces currently divided. Leveraging the network, we created (1) a crypto-loans marketplace integrated with a (2) cash management system. These give crypto-holders fiat liquidity by taking collateralised loans and allowing real-time crypto-to-fiat payments to 180 countries. Speaker:Hiroyuki is co-founder and COO of BridgeX Network. Previous to this role, Hiroyuki spearheaded the regional investment and acquisitions for Yello Mobile, one of two unicorn startups from Korea. Hiroyuki was also at GREE Ventures, focusing on Series A investments across Southeast Asia, with notable portfolio companies like Bukalapak (Indonesia's fourth unicorn), and Luxola (acquired by Sephora). He also has extensive experience with equity derivatives trading systems while at the IT department of Macquarie Securities Group He holds a bachelors degree in e-business with a masters in applied finance, both from Macquarie University. Please visit https://bridgex.network for more information.
events.location: Paypal Innovation Lab, 5 Temasek Boulevard #07-01, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore, 038985

events.name: Azure SQL Database Managed Instance
events.description: TOPIC: Azure SQL Database Managed Instance – The Better Alternative to Azure SQL Database or SQL Server in a VM? With Azure SQL Database Managed Instance Microsoft brings a new offer for the Data Platform, which can be regarded as hybrid between PaaS and IaaS. In this session, we'll look at how this new database provisioning option compares to Azure SQL Database and SQL Server in a VM to answer the questions: What are the benefits, what may be missing for one or the other, and for which scenarios does the Managed Instance make the most sense? ============================ SPEAKER: Andreas Wolter The speaker, Andreas Wolter, founder of Sarpedon Quality Lab, has specialized in SQL Server for over 17 years. He is one of only 7 Microsoft Certified Solutions Masters for the "Data Platform" (MCSM) worldwide. His focus is on high-performance OLTP systems and large data warehouse architectures. You can also find him online at Twitter: AndreasWolter and www.andreas-wolter.com/ ============================ FOOD On a happier note, Microsoft would be sponsoring food for this meetup, so we need RSVP. ============================ IMPORTANT TO KNOW: YOUR PHOTO ID! Kindly remember to bring photo ID to get through NTUC Centre Building security at Level 1.
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.description: IoTSG is pleased to partner with ConnecTechAsia 2018With this partnership, we are bringing not only the benefits to IoTSG members but also some interesting discussion at the conference.IoTSG will also have a booth at the exhibition- exact booth details to be posted soon.
